# CPBarButtonProviding

**Protocol**

The methods that templates use to provide buttons for the navigation bar.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol CPBarButtonProviding : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

`CPBarButtonProviding` is a protocol that templates use to provide a Back button and leading and trailing buttons for the navigation bar.

You don’t adopt this protocol in your own types. If you want to add buttons to the navigation bar, you must use one of the prebuilt templates that already conforms to the protocol, such as [doc://com.apple.carplay/documentation/CarPlay/CPMapTemplate] or [doc://com.apple.carplay/documentation/CarPlay/CPContactTemplate].



## Providing Navigation Bar Buttons

- **backButton**: A button to display as the Back button on the navigation bar.
- **leadingNavigationBarButtons**: An array of bar buttons to display on the leading side of the navigation bar.
- **trailingNavigationBarButtons**: An array of bar buttons to display on the trailing side of the navigation bar.
- **CPBarButton**: A button for placement in a navigation bar.
- **CPMessageComposeBarButton**: A button that activates Siri and initiates the compose message flow.

## General Purpose Templates

- **CPListTemplate**: A template that displays and manages a list of items.
- **CPGridTemplate**: A template that displays and manages a grid of items.
- **CPTabBarTemplate**: A container template that displays and manages other templates, presenting them as tabs.
- **CPTemplate**: An abstract base class for interface templates.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol

## Conforming Types

- CPContactTemplate
- CPGridTemplate
- CPInformationTemplate
- CPListTemplate
- CPMapTemplate
- CPPointOfInterestTemplate
